intro: Hieracium noricum, commonly known as the Austrian hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are lance-shaped with rough textures. Hieracium noricum is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its aggressive growth habits.
